benchmark_details.name: FakeClaim: A Multiple Platform-driven Dataset for Identification of Fake News on 2023 Israel-Hamas War
benchmark_details.overview: The paper introduces the first publicly available dataset of factual claims from different platforms and fake YouTube videos on the 2023 Israel-Hamas war for automatic fake YouTube video classification. The dataset comprises 1,499 claims collected from 1,370 fact-checked articles published by 60 fact-checking organizations in 30 languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the benchmark is to provide a dataset for automatic fake YouTube video classification and to support research in fake news detection.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The true class was not manually checked or fact-checked.

data.source: Collected from 1,370 fact-checked articles published by 60 fact-checking organizations in 30 languages.
data.annotation: Enriched with metadata curated by trained journalists specialized in fact-checking.

methodology.calculation: F1 Score is calculated based on precision and recall.
methodology.interpretation: An F1 Score closer to 1 indicates better model performance.
methodology.baseline_results: Universal Sentence Encoder achieved a Macro F1 of 87%.
methodology.validation: Classified each video using textual information and user comments.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Users' personal information is neither used nor stored for classification in this paper.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The dataset is available publicly for further research following the policy for sharing data.
